block.p: Debra Rosenberg, a journalist, and David Lipscomb, a college professor, are to be married this evening by Cantor David Shneyer at the Mexican Cultural Institute in Washington.

Ms. Rosenberg, 33, who will keep her name, is the White House correspondent for Newsweek magazine. She graduated magna cum laude from Wellesley College and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia University. She is the daughter of Joan Rosenberg and Paul Rosenberg of Bowie, Md. Her father is a lawyer in Suitland, Md. Her mother coordinates precollege programs at the University of Maryland at College Park. The bride was a widow.
Debra Rosenberg, a journalist, and David Lipscomb, a college professor, are to be married this evening by Cantor David Shneyer at the Mexican Cultural Institute in Washington.

Ms. Rosenberg, 33, who will keep her name, is the White House correspondent for Newsweek magazine. She graduated magna cum laude from Wellesley College and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia University. She is the daughter of Joan Rosenberg and Paul Rosenberg of Bowie, Md. Her father is a lawyer in Suitland, Md. Her mother coordinates precollege programs at the University of Maryland at College Park. The bride was a widow.

Mr. Lipscomb, 39, is an adjunct assistant professor of English at Georgetown University in Washington. He is also an editor of online material and a writing trainer for Ketchum, a public relations firm. He graduated cum laude from Williams College and received his Ph.D. in English from Columbia University.

He is a son of James Lipscomb of River Hills, Wis., and the late Aliceann Lipscomb, and a stepson of Priscilla Lipscomb. His father retired as the general manager for direct marketing for the Western Publishing Company in New York, and later from that same position at Ideals Books in Nashville.
